jjil.algorithm.j2se
Class HaarClassifierCascade.HaarFeature

java.lang.Object
  jjil.algorithm.j2se.HaarClassifierCascade.HaarFeature
Enclosing class:
HaarClassifierCascade
protected class HaarClassifierCascade.HaarFeature
extends java.lang.Object

HaarFeature defines an individual feature used by the Haar cascade. A feature consists of up to three weighted rectangles (implemented by HaarRect) which are convolved with the image. Their sum is the result of applying the HaarFeature to the image.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

HaarClassifierCascade.HaarFeature

public HaarClassifierCascade.HaarFeature(java.io.InputStreamReader isr)
                                  throws jjil.core.Error,
                                         java.io.IOException
Loads a HaarFeature from an input stream. This is the only way to create a HaarFeature. The expected input is "(hf "Haar rect [0]" "Haar rect [1]" "Haar rect [2]" tilted) where tilted is 1 if the rectangles are tilted, 0 if not. Tilted rectangles are currently not implemented. The Haar rectangles can be null, which means they have an area of 0.

Parameters:
isr - Input stream. The expected input is "(hf "Haar rect [0]" "Haar rect [1]" "Haar rect [2]" tilted) where tilted is 1 if the rectangles are tilted, 0 if not.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the input stream reader methods return IOException, or we get an early end of file.
jjil.core.Error - if the input is not in the expected format.
Method Detail

eval

public float eval(jjil.core.Gray32Image image)
Applies the HaarFeature to the image and returns the integer equal to the result of convolving the rectangles in the feature with the image.

Parameters:
image - the input image to which the feature is to be applied. The width should be equal to the last width parameter passed to setWidth().
Returns:
the integer equal to the result of convolving the rectangles in the feature with the image.

setWidth

public void setWidth(int nWidth)
Changes the image width for the current feature. The image width is used to pre-calculate the offsets of the rectangles within the image.

Parameters:
nWidth - The expected image width.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of the HaarFeature. Passing this String to the constructor via an input stream will create a HaarFeature with the same behavior.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A string representation of the HaarFeature.
